definitions.definition: A worded or expressed sentence , phrase , or only a word on its own, which asks for information , a reply , or a response ; an interrogative .
A subject or topic for consideration or investigation .
examples: The question of seniority will be discussed at the meeting.
There was a question of which material to use.
I've ordered it all, but there’s still the question of who’s going to pay.

definitions.definition: A doubt or challenge about the truth, accuracy , or validity of a matter.
examples: His claim to the property has come under question .
The story is true beyond question .

definitions.definition: A proposal to a meeting as a topic for deliberation .
examples: I move that the question be put to a vote.

definitions.label_groups: now archaic , historical , chiefly with definite article

main_definition: A worded or expressed sentence , phrase , or only a word on its own, which asks for information , a reply , or a response ; an interrogative .
secondary_definitions: A subject or topic for consideration or investigation .
A doubt or challenge about the truth, accuracy , or validity of a matter.
A proposal to a meeting as a topic for deliberation .
( now archaic , historical , chiefly with definite article ) Interrogation by torture .
